reviewText: Marie Osmond shot this film just after completing the film "Goin' Coconuts" with brother Donny. This film is based on the short story "Gift of the Magi" by O. Henry. Marie plays "Beth" in  the film, a rich orphan who is assigned to marriage in turn of the century  New York. Beautiful period costumes and superb acting make this movie a  Christmas classic! Shot entirely at Osmond Studios in Orem Utah in  September-October 1978 for airing in December 1978.

this movie conveys the real meaning of the holiday spirit and demonstrates what is truly important in life and relationships. Beautifully costumed in turn-of-the-century New York...a priceless holiday story of love and  sacrifice. a must-have for your video library!!
This is a version of O'Henry's, "The Gift of the Magi".  It's an old movie and ok. If you know the story, skip this movie.

Very absorbing narrative and performances. Glad James Woods figured out that he and Marie Osmond would be the worst train wreck. Before I retired from teaching, I showed this video every Christmas to minority students in the ghetto and privileged students in the suburbs - tough crowds who usually don't like anything but action movies with explosions. But ALL these high school students liked the film. One male student who was way too cool and gangsta for everything even asked who Marie Osmond was, said she was pretty, and speculated that she was probably French!

ah yes, good ole "social class" distinctions wherein the Lodges speak only to the Cabots and the Cabots speak only to [belligerent blasphemy omitted], wherein John Pierpont Morgan put an actual gun to the heads of the then banking community to compel them to unduly "trust" each other which was the fore runner of the current felony illegal seizures of American account balances with any of them.  Realistically "other-centeredness" can't overcome poverty, perhaps especially in the indicated mileu of 1902 when that set of robber barons was ruling the country. O.Henry must be rolling in his grave to have his name associated with this film, which, with the exception of the last couple of minutes, bears no resemblance at all to his well-loved tale, "The Gift of the Magi." This movie is so bad, it makes Disney's "Condorman" look like high art. Other than some ornate costumes and Marie Osmond's teeth, there's not much to see here.

You can tell from the first five or ten minutes that this is going to be a cheesy movie. They probably spent a lot of money on the costumes and staging yet they come across as cheap and I'll-suited to the time period or story. It's amusing to see Maria Osmond, James Woods and June Lockhart from the 1970's but don't expect great acting skills from any of them in this film. I did actually watch the entire film but don't feel like you have to make the same sacrifice. I imagine this is one of the worst adaptations of O'Henry's "The Gift of the Magi" available. As I said in my title, it is family friendly, but that's about all it has going for it.

What a beautiful picture of what real love is.  It is thinking of the other person before yourself.  It is simply honest.  It is happily committed to another's well-being, and its source is from non other than God, himself.  What a wonderfully told story.  Delightful.  And, to tie this beautiful love story into the season that celebrates the greatest love story of all -- Christmas, with God sending his son, Jesus, into the world to save us from the sin that separates us from him ---- all because God loves us so much . . . this, makes this movie's message all the more powerful.  Thank you to the creators of this film, for putting together such a touching masterpiece.  Very well done, and thank you!

This movie was an excellent adaptation of O'Henry' s "The Gift of the Magj." The main characters are developed well. The girl gives up a fortune to marry a penniless immigrant. Each sells their most precious possession for a wedding gift for the other. She has her hair cut and sold to buy a watch chain for his heirloom watch, and he sold his watch to buy her combs for her hair. True, unselfish love prevails. A thoroughly enjoyable movie.

this film is a blast from the past with its moral values and careful attention to detail and appropriateness.  Old School and a great "chick flick" that is tremendously outdated by today's film standards but a good representation of the story line behind O'Henry's (narrating the story) "Gift of the Magi".  Marie Osmond and James Woods do a delightful job of personalizing the humanism in this story and need for us to "follow our call".

This movie is sort of a pre-quel to the wonderful O. Henry story, "The Gift of the Magi," purporting to tell how the two main characters met. I love Marie Osmond as singer, and Timothy Bottoms was pretty good as an actor, but this story line and dialogue were ridiculous. The hackneyed "romance novel" premise -- i.e. boy meets girl/girl hates boy, boy charms girl/girl hates boy, followed by the inevitable "come-to-realize" moment when girl likes boy/boy tests girl -- is so trite and unimaginative, it's embarrassing to watch. I would not recommend this movie for anyone over the age of 11.
I only watched a few minutes of it and it was so corny, I couldn't take any more.  Maybe it's a good plot but I didn't watch any more to find out.

It's not that I don't like it...I just think that Marie's talent was not acting so much as singing.  She's darling, of course, as is Timothy Buttons.  The whole script was thin and needed a good editor.  It can be said that it's thoroughly wholesome -- but as for acting, thoroughly ordinary.
Editing, script, dialogue, directing... It's all bad.  I like Marie Osmond but not her character.

My family has been watching this movie every single Christmas Eve ever since I can remember.  It's a family favorite, and Christmas just wouldn't be the same without it! When our VHS tape began to finally fall apart, we were soooo thankful to find a DVD copy here on Amazon.  The Gift of Love is funny, heart-breaking, heart-warming, exciting, and all-in-all a beautiful love story. The acting is awesome for all of the actors except for Beth (Marie Osmond), which is unfortunate since she's the main character.  She isn't terribly or anything, but I do think the rest of the cast are better actors/actresses than her, especially Mary (Sondra West).  Anytime Mary and Beth are in the same scene, Beth out-shines her.  I wish I could find other movies/shows that Sondra West acted in, but it's like she fell off the planet after this show.  :-(  Anyway, aside from the quality of Marie Osmond's acting, this movie is fantastic and a great addition to anyone's movie collection.

Terrible movie! Very contrived and poor acting, costumes were awful, and even the dance scenes were ridiculous. (They were bouncing up and down, never seen that before). The story line was boringly formula and the characters were shallow.  My sister and I and niece watched almost half way through,  trying to give it a chance and hoping it would redeem itself somewhere.  We were actually suffering, it was that intolerable.  Seriously.  I was actually amazed at how bad it was on every single point. It could have won an award just for that!  Even when the lead actress had her hair come undone (twice, no joke) from her "potential" romantic interest, it was dry and bushy instead of the scene being romantically enhanced by her "cascading locks" spilling down or whatever! They couldn't even get that bit right. Unbelievable.

Yes, it's a bit old fashioned and yes, it's somewhat predictable. But then, in great measure, so is pure love. This story evolves around multiple disciplines and emotions; e.g., loyalty, promises, obedience, hope, perseverance, longing, honor, false guilt, anger, trust, desire, etc. It is well told by the actors and narrator, and serves as a fine example of how love surpasses the lesser things in life, despite how those lesser things are often viewed by some as the most meaningful. Like the old saying clearly states, "love conquers all."

My very favorite movie!  I remember seeing this on TV many years ago and being captivated by the story.  I hunted down the title on the internet and am so glad I found it.  This movie presents a sweet, tender, and innocent portrayal of real, true love. Far too many people think this no longer exists, but it does. I know from personal experience! This is an excellent movie for singles, marrieds, and families. I've watched it 4 times in the week I've had it! Beautiful!
Bought it for my co-worker and he loves it so much. He stated that he would recommend it to everyone.

Just ordered this to replace my old VHS copy which is ancient and grainy. I am a period-film freak, especially the Victorian and Edwardian ages so therefore have always loved watching this movie which is also a sweet version of the Gift of the Magi. The costumes have always intrigued me the most and that, coupled with the fact that I am the same age as Marie Osmond, and was once a big fan of the Brothers' music (that's where the nostalgia comes in), has kept me watching this at least once a year. I like that others have mentioned it as a Christmas tradition and would like to start that in my own family too because they just don't make them like this anymore. I think Marie was pretty good as the young lady, if not great. It's very melodramatic in parts but that's the genre and style, enjoy it and try not to judge it when immersed in today's societal harshness. It's a tale of sacrifice and love, not often told.
Loved this movie ever since it first aired!  The little girl who sits next to Marie while she sings the title song, "The Gift of Love" is just adorable!

My middle school students first read a revised copy of the "Gift of the Magi", by O Henry.  They learned about Irony through this story.  Then they watched "The Gift of Love".  This DVD truely brought the story alive for my students!
Cyndy Ulrich
Rainier Middle School
Auburn, WA

This is a cute Christmas movie, along the lines of current Hallmark TV Christmas movie specials, but made in the 1980's.  This is loosely based on the classic O Henry short story, "The Gift of the Magi".  It stars Marie Osmond and was probably meant as a star-making vehicle for her but she is supported by two really good actors in it - Timothy Bottoms and James Woods.  It's a sweet love story, set in turn of the century NY at Christmastime! I thought this was out of print and was really pleased to see it offered on DVD.
This movie was way too long.  Marie Osmond is lovely, but her petulant and whining voice was tiresome.  Read O'Henry's classic story and skip this annoying movie.

I watched this touching story of love and selfless giving many years ago, probably when it was first made in 1978, and have never had the opportunity to see it again.  When I found it was on DVD, I was thrilled to be able to buy it for my collection of Christmas movies.

The story is based on a short story written by O. Henry, a writer of the late 19th century, called The Gift of the Magi.  This movie is a story set in the early 1900s, so the wardrobes and sets bring you back to a more romantic time.  It's about a young couple who fall in love against the wishes of family and out of line with proper associations between the classes.

Marie Osmond is beautiful as the young Beth promised in marriage to a wealthy man she does not love.  She sings a beautiful song "The Gift of Love" upon which they drew the name of the movie.  Timothy Bottoms is Rudy, an immigrant from Switzerland (also destined to marry a girl he does not love).  In keeping with the original story, they both sacrifice the most valuable things they own to give a gift to the other.

This is a love story made back in the day when a love story wasn't about sex, money, or a reality show.  You can watch this one with your whole family and feel good about the message your children will go away with.

The movie arrived very well packaged, which is important to me and in a very timely manner. I hadn't seen the movie in years so it was fun to be able to purchase it for such a reasonable price, (I have next to no budget for movies in this economy)and add it to my library. Sometimes it's fun to just turn off all the chaos of today and relax with a nice, fun movie and this is definitely one of those.

I've loved this movie since I was a kid, especially being a fan of the old Donny & Marie Show.  It's a little on the cheezy side, but a lovely story none the less.  I look forward to watching it every Christmas!

My daughter wanted this DVD  for Christmas, since she saw it when she was much younger.  I have not seen it on TV for many years, neither had she, so we ordered it from Amazon.com a week before Christmas, not expecting to get it before Christmas.  It came 3 days before Christmas and we enjoyed watching it so much.  It was a Gift of Love!  Thanks for getting it to us earlier than expected.
I'd give them an Excellent.  It came in great shape and in a timely manner.  I definitely will order from them again. Thanks, BB

A sweet love story where two young people unexpectedly fall in love and the young lady calls off a prearranged marriage offering great wealth and a life of ease in favor of a life offering only true love. How does it end? Buy the movie. You won't be disappointed.
 By the way, The song The Precious Gift of Love will stick in your mind and you will find yourself singing and humming; but you won't mind. The words are lovely and the tune is simply beautiful.

I really enjoyed this movie.  The story is the classic one of the Gift of the Magi.
The scenery & costumes are beautiful.  If you have a few hours of free time & it's snowing -
get yourself a cup of hot chocolate, a fuzzy blanket & put the fireplace on.  This movie is all
you need to take youself away & get you in the holiday spirit.  Two thumbs up...

I love this movie.  The message is timeless.  I remember watching this movie when I was a little girl.  I loved it then and I was surprised at how much I love it now.  It is exactly as I remember.  This is a movie the whole family will enjoy.  It was fun to show it to my teenagers. They thought they would hate it but they didn't they thought it was "okay", which translated into parent terms it was better than they thought it would be.  The movie is clean, no swearing, no nudity, no inappropriate jokes or innuendos. Just a good old fashioned Christmas Story about being selfless and cherishing the ones you love.  Marie and Timothy are fantastic as well as the rest of the cast.  I especially enjoyed watching a young James Woods, who plays the nerdy fiance to Marie. The one draw back is with the cinematography, you can definitely tell it was filmed on a sound stage. But other than that this movie is a treasure.  I wish they would show it every year on TV.  But since they don't I had to buy it.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time many years ago as teenager and loving it back then. I found it again and still love how sweet and innocent a love story this is. It will bring a sweet spirit into your home! I plan on showing it to my teenagers this holiday season. They may think it kindof cheesy but I think they will still like it!

This is a true classic and a must have for every household, regardless the format you may require.  This shows the true meaning of LOVE and SACRIFICE how priorities will give us a cvhance to "walk the talk".
If you love the Osmonds, you will love this.  It is a bit hokey, but it is full of romance. And Timothy Bottoms is cute.

The title says it all, because I really love this movie. Marie Osmond and Tomothy Bottoms give a really great and believable, yet entertaining performance in this warm hearted, charming and romantic story. I really loved some of the dresses that Marie wore in the film. They were beautiful and elegant. I loved this movie when it first was shown on tv, and still love it today. This movie continues to be charming and entertaining. I especially loved the ending.The Gift of Love

The Gift of Love I really enjoyed this DVD. I remember seeing it as a Teenager. Mom would make us popcorn as we sat and watched this christmas story. Marie did very well acting in this one. The costumes of that Era were absolutely beautiful and Marie looked stunning wearing them. Although Marie could make a potato sack look good. All that beauty and talent given to just one person seems totally unfair lol. I would recommend this DVD to all Marie fans

Long ago I watched this and loved it. I was very young and I guess times changed and the movie now is nice, but a bit corny too. It is a lovely story, but in todays world it would need a lot of polish and better writting. Timothy Bottoms was not as good as you would want him to be. Marie Osmond was surprisingly wonderful. If only she would go back to acting. It makes you wonder what she'd be like today. She was very young making this movie and very good at it.

I have grown up with this movie and agree that this movie is in fact a holiday classic. It's like a fairy tale but played very effectively. This is an instant classic for those who like sweet romance.
So often we think only of what we can get at Christmas.  Here is a couple who think only of each other.  What a different world it would be if we all thought that way.

Great movie! I showed it to my students after reading O. Henry's "The Gift of the Magi". It made for a great lesson on comparison/contrast after reading the story. My students had no clue who Marie Osmond was and were impressed with her singing. One student said, "She sure can sing!" Yes, she certainly can. She is also a delightful actress. It's a great DVD to show right before Christmas vacation.

Chances are, if you are reading this review, you are already a fan of this movie, or a fan of Maire Osmond, either of which makes you a superbly fantastic person.  Congratulations on the wonderfulness that is you.  Now, onto the movie. . . While often passed off just as a Christmas movie (and, don't get me wrong it should be watched at least twice every Holiday season), I also just watch this movie when I am a little down or feeling really happy already.  It will leave you warm and tingly for days.  I truly don't think the story could be any sweeter, or acted any more lovingly.  Now, it is easy to assume that such a sweet love story would be cheesy.  It's not, not at all.  However, it is the definition of innocence, which can be mistaken as cheesy.  The acting, as stated before, is perfect for the story, the one song she sings is haunting and will stay with you, the filming technique (while dated and not high quality) actually adds a warmth and dimension to the film.  Get this movie, share it with someone you can snuggle up close to and fall asleep with.  Truly wonderful!

I will admit that I heaved a sigh of disappointment when I saw Marie Osmond step out of the carriage.  However, she quickly won me over and I loved every minute of this film after that.  This story is wonderfully touching and in the end, their gifts to one another are funny but really felt.  You KNOW that they are gifts from the heart.  This movie really is about love at Christmastime and the actors in this version couldn't have been better chosen.  They all do a great job and I would recommend this film to anyone!  I plan to watch it time and again!

Even though the box says it is closed-captioned (CC), I could not make captions show up on my computer using various software or on my portable DVD player.  I finally came to the conclusion that the company evidently goofed not incorporating the captions in the DVD edition.  I sent e-mail to the company that created it and they never replied.  NOTE:  Closed-captioning (CC) is for hearing-impaired people who get more enjoyment out of the movie when closed-captions (e.g. subtitles) are shown.

This Osmond production is one of the best family movies out there.  It is a touching story with excellent acting by Marie Osmond and Timothy Bottoms and all the supporting cast as well. I particularly like the friendship between Beth and Mary the servant girl.  My teenage niece said there was only one "cheesy" part when the main characters reunite at the end.  I prefer to call it touching, lol! :-)  The costumes, the story line, EVERYTHING, is extremely well done.  It supports Christian and family values, and there is certainly nothing that is in any way offensive.  I would highly recommend this one.  The Christmas theme also adds a nice touch.  I also will mention that the video is closed captioned, although it does not say so on the case.  I am glad for that as the two oldest Osmond brothers, who have a hearing loss, can more easily watch their sister in this outstanding film!

The Gift of Love is my most favorite Christmas video!  I watch it several times a year.  It is a touching and heartwarming story of true love.  I enjoy the playful and serious side of Marie Osmond and Timothy Bottoms.  The two make a great duo - giving O'Henry's story, character and spice!  I especially love the part when 'Marie' walks out the door with Mary to try and find Rudy - hoping it's not too late to catch him as he sets sail.  To her dismay, she cannot find him - then Rudy comes to her door, finding that she has left with a "hooligan".  They meet at the care center (the musicbox is playing) and they vow to love each other through thick and thin -- and plan to marry on Christmas!  What a delightful movie!!!

I have been looking for this movie since VHS's were available.  The movie is Wonderful!  Yes, I have grown to love Marie Osmond over the years...this movie made me an avid fan both of her singing & acting abilities. I saw this movie for the first time when it was shown on TV in the 70's.  Chalk it up to a teenager's raging emotions back then, but this love story hit home as the kind of love I wanted in my life!  Please watch it and succumb to all of your emotions!  This is a wonderful version of O'Henry's novel, "The Gift of the Magi".  PS:  Beautiful clothes too.

I have sat for many CHRISTmas seasons in a row and watched this video.  It is one of the best movies around that demonstrate the reason for the season, and how we ideally should end up treating each other in our close  personal relationships!  I would recommend it to ANYONE; I usually sit and  watch it with my two girls - and we always cry at the end, even thought we  know what is coming!
BUY IT AND ENJOY!

I saw this movie back when it was first on tv and i loved it. Marie Osmond was so good in this movie . She is in love with a man that her family does not want her to bother with but she goes with her heart. a very good love  story.

I have watched this movie over and over.  I think this is what Christmas is all about!  The love between these two young people is just a beautiful story and how they struggled to make it happen. This has become a holiday tradition  around my house and hope it will for you also.
